elements.title: origami fortune tellers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that origami fortune tellers (example pictured) may have originated in Europe rather than Japan?

elements.title: Celina Mikolajczak (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as an undergraduate, battery engineer Celina Mikolajczak discovered a supernova?

elements.title: an ancient Roman column (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that King Hussein of Jordan gifted an ancient Roman column to New York City for the 1964–65 World's Fair?

elements.title: Laura Roslin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Battlestar Galactica character Laura Roslin has been compared to Machiavelli's Lucretia and Virgil's Dido?

elements.title: a Florida TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Florida TV station abruptly removed programs from its schedule after it became unable to pay distributors?

elements.title: Kamrussamad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kamrussamad lost five Indonesian elections before finally winning a seat on the People's Representative Council in 2019?

elements.title: Akademia Nasionala del Ladino (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Akademia Nasionala del Ladino in Israel is dedicated to preserving the Judaeo-Spanish language?

elements.title: Emily and Jerry Spiegel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Emily and Jerry Spiegel's deaths, their daughters held rival art auctions?
